legacy.full_text: What the US really needs to do is return the frozen Afghan central bank assets to the Afghan people and stop abusing force to invade other countries or interfere in their internal affairs. This is the only way to prevent the tragedy in Afghanistan from happening again. https://t.co/N2Q2zTXdKz

1/4 Wang Wenbin: We noted the US State Department report of the After Action Review on Afg. Regrettably, issues that truly call for review and reflection of the US were not touched upon in the report. These include the use of force against a sovereign country in violation of https://t.co/Yaokvtj9UW

3/4 If the US’s review was only meant to make the next “Kabul moment” more orderly and presentable, it would not serve as a responsible explanation to the world. What the US really needs to do is to return the Afg central bank assets to the Afg people, lift unilateral sanctions

4/4 against Afghanistan, fundamentally abandon the policy of abuse of force and correct its acts of blatantly invading other countries and interfering in their internal affairs, and avoid a repeat of the tragedy of Afghanistan.
